Let Д Г,  and P denote respectively the images of D,  Г,  and P under T The mean curvature oî Г Ri P is evidently given by
We choose a so large that Я < 0 Then according to Theorem 3 there exists smooth boundary data f oa Г such that the Dirichlet problem for the minimal surface equation m D IS not solvable
Transforming the data f on Г into corresponding data f on ГЪу means of the inverse relation T'^ and similarly transforming the minimal surface equation m D into a responding equation m D,  completes the proof of the theorem Indeed,  the data / can be assumed to have arbitraiily small absolute value,  the resulting equation m D has the form ( 17 ) with
( 1 + a'ul + ul + + ul ) ^ ' ' ( 1 + a'ui + 4 + + ul ) 2 ' and the Dirichlet problem clearly can have no solution
Note This research was partially supported by the Air Force Office of Scientific Research under Grant No Af - AFOSR 883 - 65
